tagDescription: BELL, Robert Letters from various members of Bell's family about family matters and daily events in the lives of the correspondents.
RUGGLES, Timothy Account of Colonel Ruggles and Colonel Thatcher's regiment, 13 May 1756.
NELSON, Hugh Letter from Hugh Nelson to an unknown recipient, 16 May 1888.
BELL, Robert A list of items is available in the Lande catalogue.

FREDERICTON AND MONCTON, N.B. Map showing the frontage on River Saint John at Fredericton, 24 cm x 53 cm, [n.d.]; map of the town of Moncton showing land taken and fenced in by Mr. Giles in 1854 for European and North American Railway, signed by Alexander L. Light, chief engineer, 23 cm x 48 cm, 23 January 1857.

SHELBURNE Obligations by John McMullan and Laughlin McKinnon, 7 January 1785 (2 pages), by Alexander McLean and Laughlin McKinnon, 21 January 1785 (2 pages), and by John Curry, 20 February 1785 (1 page), all late of the 76th Regiment, towards John McKillip, merchant of Shelburne. Lease of a water lot with buildings, situated in Shelburne, by James Smith to Cornelius Tyson and John Rees, 26 March 1785 (3 pages); receipt to Charles Whitworth signed by Nathaniel Hannah, 6 November 1786 (2 pages); letter of Attorney from Isabella Fraser, of Shelburne, widow of the late Captain Donald Fraser, to James Tidburry from London, 9 May 1827 (2 pages).

YUKON [ca. 1900] Nine photographs from Kinsey and Kinsey, photographers, relating to gold mining operations in the Yukon; one photograph by Cawthon of Washington, showing five men wearing team hats and shirts; one photograph by Cantwell entitled Steam plant No. 16 Eldorado.
PIERCE, F., & Co. Register of sales of poisons from the 1st May 1875 to 20 June 1882, with the name and signature of the purchaser, the name and quantity of poison sold and the purpose.
HOWE, Robert Location ticket of a land in [New Brunswick] granted to Robert Howe by the Surveyor-General, 8 December 1823.
BELL, Robert Returns for mineral statistics of Nova Scotia mines, issued in connection with the Geological Survey of Canada; also correspondence and memos relating to the returns.
LITTLEDALE, Isaac Protest on a bill of exchange by notary George Orred at the request of Thomas and Isaac Littledale, 12 March 1813.
LITTLEDALE, Thomas Protest on a bill of exchange by notary George Orred at the request of Thomas and Isaac Littledale, 12 March 1813.
JAMES BAY Map of James Bay from Charlton Island to Strutton Island, showing ship's tracks from Moose [Factory] and giving soundings and directions of tides. Cloth, 37 cm x 25 cm.
ARMSTRONG, William Letters patent of William Armstrong for his invention of a portable fire extinguishing machine, Montreal, 3 September 1844 and 3 May 1847.
MONK, Samuel Policy of Samuel W. Monk from the Alliance British & Foreign Life and Fire Assurance Company, 2 December 1846.

BROADSIDES Resolutions To be proposed, by Mr. Morin [Augustin Norbert Morin], in a Committee of the whole House, on the Reports of the Standing Committee of Public Accounts, [ca.1836] (2 pages); printed letter to General Sutherland at Gibraltar, U.S., and all others whom it may concern by W.W. Dodge, prisoner in Monroe, Michigan, 13 January 1838 (1 page); letter to the independent electors of the County of Beauharnois by Jacob DeWitt, 1st October 1840 (1 page); broadside advertising goods in country stores of Thomas Darling, June 1861 (1 page).
BELL, Robert Correspondence, notes, reports assembled by Bell.
NEARD, Isaac Letter from John Stuart to Isaac Neard, 28 May 1812.

MÉNARD, François Codicille (du testament) de François Ménard, de la paroisse de Saint-Antoine, fait avant de partir à la guerre, [s.d., XVIIIe siècle] (3 pages); acte rédigé par le notaire Antoine Adhémar impliquant Claude et Pierre Volant de Saint-Claude, fils de Claude et de Françoise Radisson, [s.d., XVIIe siècle] (2 pages).
ALLEN, John Return of Clothing, Arms, Accoutrements etc. issued by the Quarter Master General of Militia from the Militia Store at Fredericton..., signed by John Allen, 28 March 1844.
BELL, Robert [n.d.], 1865-1885 one photograph of Robert Bell
BELL, Robert [n.d.], 1865-1885 Some art work and original sketches by Robert Bell together with proof copies of engravings for published articles by him
CHAMPLAIN & ST. LAWRENCE RAILROAD Book of Reference to Accompany Map of Proposed Branch of the Champlain & St. Lawrence R.R. across Ash Island, by A.H. Vaughan, land surveyor, 14 January 1852.
HATCH, E.F. Remittance bill from the Accountant General of the Navy, F.J. Briggs, to E.F. Hatch, St. Andrews, New Brunwswick, 23 January 1845
SCHULTZ, Sir John Christian Receipt to John Schultz signed by Jacob Whiteford, 9 October 1872.

BELL, William Arithmetic book entitled A Key to Gray's Introduction to Arithmetic, containing the Solution of all the Questions in that Work with Notes, by William Bell, Edinburg, Alex. Peat and Co. Publishers, 1824.

HARVEY HILL MINES, Canada East Map showing the Transverse Section of Hall's Lode, Campbell's Lode & Copper-bearing Slates, Harvey Hill Mines-Canada East, signed by Fraser Bennetts, Jr., mine agent, 10 September 1862.

MONTGOMERY, Richard Broadside of articles of capitulation made and entered into between Richard Montgomery and the citizens and inhabitants of Montreal, Montreal, 12 November 1775. Printed by John Dunlap.

De WITT, Jacob Déclarations assermentées de 19 électeurs du comté de Beauharnois relatives aux troubles provoqués par les partisans de monsieur Dunscomb contre les électeurs appuyant Jacob De Witt au bureau de vote du village de Durham lors des élections de 1841, 1841-1842 (73 pages). Protêt à la réquisition de Jacob De Witt contre William Bowran, officier rapporteur pour l'élection du comté de Beauharnois, 9 mars 1841 (4 pages).
CRAWLEY, Thomas Warrant from John Kempt ordering Thomas Crawley to measure and lay out a lot of 150 acres for Ann Casey in Indian Bay, 25 February 1822.
CHAPAIS, Jean-Charles Lettre de P.-L. Morin à Chapais concernant les origines de son grand-père Chapais, 12 septembre 1862.
